note:
Oddball, computer nerd, aspiring ecosystem co-creator, I've lead a strange and unlikely life. I dropped out of high school and was homeless for several years. During that time I learned Reiki, and how to operate and program Linux computers. I decided to get a job as a programmer, so I created a project and presented it at CodeCon 2004. That led to a career as a computer programmer. I'm now semi-retired and I've turned my attention to my other passion: gardening and ecology.

note: My opinions are always improving.

I am an occupational therapist and work in a Community Mental Health Team in Cornwall. I live with Martyn and our spaniel cross Reggie. I have lived in Cheshire, Derbyshire, Suffolk, Merseyside, North Yorkshire, and currently the Tamar Valley. In my spare time, I enjoy reading, watching films and TV, walking, nature, the countryside, jigsaws, colouring, and embroidery. My main hobby is taking photos of Devon, Cornwall, and sometimes further a field. I'm also practising my street photography.

Advocate. Writer. Posts on environment, justice, and equity. I dissent. I mask. I live on the traditional territory of the Tongva (Gabrieleno). Former first responder, educator, and nonprofit leader. Prior Forbes nonprofit contributor. Views are my own. She/her/hers.
